member.value: An array of three numbers [XW YW ZW] specifying the tristimulus value, in the CIE 1931 XYZ space, of the diffuse white point. The numbers XW and ZW must be positive, and YW must be equal to 1.0.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.ColorSpace.PdfKnownColorSpace.BaseColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the base colorspace.
member.value: The color space in which the values in the color table are to be interpreted.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.ColorSpace.PdfKnownColorSpace.MaxColorIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the max color.
member.value: The maximum index that can be used to access the values in the color table.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.ColorSpace.PdfKnownColorSpace.IndexedColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the color table.
member.remarks: The color table data must be m * (maxIndex + 1) bytes long, where m is the number of color components in the base color space. Each byte is an unsigned integer in the range 0 to 255 that is scaled to the range of the corresponding color component in the base color space; that is, 0 corresponds to the minimum value in the range for that component, and 255 corresponds to the maximum.

member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.General.Paper.Drawing.Rendering.Ps.BlendMode.InnerEnum.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.General.Paper.Drawing.Rendering.Ps.BlendMode.InnerEnum.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

members.member: An identity transform is one in which the output coordinates are always the same as the input coordinates. If this transform is anything other than the identity transform, the type will either be the constant GENERAL_TRANSFORM or a combination of the appropriate flag bits for the various coordinate conversions that this transform performs.
A translation moves the coordinates by a constant amount in x and y without changing the length or angle of vectors.

A uniform scale multiplies the length of vectors by the same amount in both the x and y directions without changing the angle between vectors. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeGeneralScale flag.

A general scale multiplies the length of vectors by different amounts in the x and y directions without changing the angle between perpendicular vectors. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeUniformScale flag.
This constant is a bit mask for any of the scale flag bits.

This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a mirror image flip about some axis which changes the normally right handed coordinate system into a left handed system in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A right handed coordinate system is one where the positive X axis rotates counterclockwise to overlay the positive Y axis similar to the direction that the fingers on your right hand curl when you stare end on at your thumb. A left handed coordinate system is one where the positive X axis rotates clockwise to overlay the positive Y axis similar to the direction that the fingers on your left hand curl. There is no mathematical way to determine the angle of the original flipping or mirroring transformation since all angles of flip are identical given an appropriate adjusting rotation.

This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a quadrant rotation by some multiple of 90 degrees in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A rotation changes the angles of vectors by the same amount regardless of the original direction of the vector and without changing the length of the vector. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeGeneralRotation flag.

This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a rotation by an arbitrary angle in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A rotation changes the angles of vectors by the same amount regardless of the original direction of the vector and without changing the length of the vector. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the
This constant is a bit mask for any of the rotation flag bits.

This constant indicates that the transform defined by this object performs an arbitrary conversion of the input coordinates. If this transform can be classified by any of the above constants, the type will either be the constant TypeIdentity or a combination of the appropriate flag bits for the various coordinate conversions that this transform performs.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that no calculations need to be performed and that the source coordinates only need to be copied to their destinations to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the translation components of the matrix (m02 and m12) need to be added to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the scaling components of the matrix (m00 and m11) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. If the ApplyShear bit is also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not both 0.0. If the ApplyShear bit is not also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not both 1.0. If neither the ApplyShear nor the ApplyScale bits are set then the scaling components are both 1.0, which means that the x and y components contribute to the transformed coordinate, but they are not multiplied by any scaling factor.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the shearing components of the matrix (m01 and m10) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. The presence of this bit in the state variable changes the interpretation of the ApplyScale bit as indicated in its documentation.
The X coordinate scaling element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.
The X coordinate shearing element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.
The X coordinate of the translation element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.
The Y coordinate shearing element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.
The Y coordinate scaling element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.
The Y coordinate of the translation element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

Manually recalculates the state of the transform when the matrix changes too much to predict the effects on the state. The following table specifies what the various settings of the state field say about the values of the corresponding matrix element fields. Note that the rules governing the SCALE fields are slightly different depending on whether the SHEAR flag is also set.
SCALE SHEAR TRANSLATE m00/m11 m01/m10 m02/m12
IDENTITY 1.0 0.0 0.0 TRANSLATE (TR) 1.0 0.0 not both 0.0 SCALE (SC) not both 1.0 0.0 0.0 TR | SC not both 1.0 0.0 not both 0.0 SHEAR (SH) 0.0 not both 0.0 0.0 TR | SH 0.0 not both 0.0 not both 0.0 SC | SH not both 0.0 not both 0.0 0.0 TR | SC | SH not both 0.0 not both 0.0 not both 0.0

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the translation components of the matrix (m03, m13, m23) need to be added to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the scaling components of the matrix (m00, m11, m22) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. If the ApplyShear bit is also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not all 0.0. If the ApplyShear bit is not also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not all 1.0. If neither the ApplyShear nor the ApplyScale bits are set then the scaling components are both 1.0, which means that the x, y and z components contribute to the transformed coordinate, but they are not multiplied by any scaling factor.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the shearing components of the matrix (m01, m02, m10, m12, m20, m21) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. The presence of this bit in the state variable changes the interpretation of the ApplyScale bit as indicated in its documentation.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the projection components of the matrix (m30, m31, m32) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the overall scaling component of the matrix (m33) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform.
The X coordinate scaling element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The YX coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The XZ coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The X coordinate of the translation element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The YX coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Y coordinate scaling element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The YZ coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Y coordinate of the translation element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The ZX coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The ZY coordinate shearing element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Z coordinate scaling element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Z coordinate of the translation element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The X projection element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Y projection element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The Z projection element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
The overall scaling element of the 4x4 affine transformation matrix.
Manually recalculates the state of the transform when the matrix changes too much to predict the effects on the state.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.General.PdfDestinationMode.Location
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the top-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A NULL value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a NULL value.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.General.PdfDestinationMode.FitToPage
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.General.PdfDestinationMode.FitH

member.summary: The length of the object group in bytes.

member.summary: The number of shared object references.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ExtendedGenericHintTable.Item7
member.summary: Starting with item 7, each of the remaining items in this table is a shared object identifierthat is, an index into the shared object hint table (described in Section F.3.2, Shared Object Hint Table).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.GenericHintTable.Item1
member.summary: The object number of the first object in the group.

member.summary: The location of the first object in the group.

member.summary: The number of objects in the group.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable
member.summary: The page offset hint table provides information required for locating each page.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item1
member.summary: The least number of objects in a page (including the page object itself).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item2
member.summary: The location of the first pages page object.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item3
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least number of objects in a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item4
member.summary: The least length of a page in bytes. This is the least length from the beginning of a page object to the last byte of the last object used by that page.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item5
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least length of a page, in bytes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item6
member.summary: The least offset of the start of any content stream, relative to the beginning of its page. (See implementation note 183 in Appendix H.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item7
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least offset to the start of the content stream. (See implementation note 183 in Appendix H.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item8
member.summary: The least content stream length. (See implementation note 184 in Appendix H.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item9
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least content stream length. (See implementation note 184 in Appendix H.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item10
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the greatest number of shared object references.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item11
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the numerically greatest shared object identifier used by the pages (discussed further in Table F.4, item 4).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item12
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the numerator of the fractional position for each shared object reference. For each shared object referenced from a page, there is an indication of where in the pages content stream the object is first referenced. That position is given as the numerator of a fraction, whose denominator is specified once for the entire document (in the next item in this table). The fraction is explained in more detail in Table F.4, item 5.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.PageOffsetHintTable.Item13
member.summary: The denominator of the fractional position for each shared object reference.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable
member.summary: The shared object hint table gives information required to locate shared objects.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item1
member.summary: The object number of the first object in the shared objects section (part 8).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item2
member.summary: The location of the first object in the shared objects section.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item3
member.summary: The number of shared object entries for the first page (including nonshared objects, as noted above).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item4
member.summary: The number of shared object entries for the shared objects section, including the number of shared object entries for the first page (that is, the value of item 3).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item5
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the greatest number of objects in a shared object group. (See also implementation note 185 in Appendix H.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item6
member.summary: The least length of a shared object group in bytes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.SharedObjectHintTable.Item7
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least length of a shared object group, in bytes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item1
member.summary: The object number of the first thumbnail image (that is, the thumbnail image that is described by the first entry in the thumbnails section).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item2
member.summary: The location of the first thumbnail image.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item3
member.summary: The number of pages that have thumbnail images.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item4
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the greatest number of consecutive pages that do not have a thumbnail image.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item5
member.summary: The least length of a thumbnail image in bytes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item6
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least length of a thumbnail image.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item7
member.summary: The least number of objects in a thumbnail image.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item8
member.summary: The number of bits needed to represent the difference between the greatest and least number of objects in a thumbnail image.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item9
member.summary: The object number of the first object in the thumbnail shared objects section (a subsection of part 9). This section includes objects (color spaces, for example) that are referenced from some or all thumbnail objects and are not referenced from any other objects. The thumbnail shared objects are undifferentiated; there is no indication of which shared objects are referenced from any given pages thumbnail image.

member.summary: The location of the first object in the thumbnail shared objects section.

member.summary: The number of thumbnail shared objects.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.LinearizedPdf.HintTables.ThumbnailHintTable.Item12
member.summary: The length of the thumbnail shared objects section in bytes.

member.summary: Decode sample data which is represented as a sequence of bytes.
member.param: The number of bits used to represent each color component.
member.returns: The sample data which is represented as a sequence of bytes.

member.name: M:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.Comm.PdfImageXObject.DecodeImageComponents(System.Int32,System.Int32,Spire.Pdf.Interfaces.IPdfPrimitive@,System.Single[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decode image components with the row range.
member.param: The color space of image components.
The number of bits used to represent each color component.
member.remarks: Sample data is represented as a stream of bytes, interpreted as 8-bit unsigned integers in the range 0 to 255. The bytes constitute a continuous bit stream, with the high-order bit of each byte first. This bit stream, in turn, is divided into units of n bits each, where n is the number of bits per component. Each unit encodes a color component value, given with high-order bit first; units of 16 bits are given with the most significant byte first. Byte boundaries are ignored, except that each row of sample data must begin on a byte boundary. If the number of data bits per row is not a multiple of 8, the end of the row is padded with extra bits to fill out the last byte.

member.name: M:Spire.Pdf.Conversion.Comm.PdfImageXObject.DecodeColorSpaceComponents(System.Int32,System.Int32,Spire.Pdf.Interfaces.IPdfPrimitive@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Decode image components with the row range.
member.param: The color space of color components.
The number of bits used to represent each color component.
member.remarks: Sample data is represented as a stream of bytes, interpreted as 8-bit unsigned integers in the range 0 to 255. The bytes constitute a continuous bit stream, with the high-order bit of each byte first. This bit stream, in turn, is divided into units of n bits each, where n is the number of bits per component. Each unit encodes a color component value, given with high-order bit first; units of 16 bits are given with the most significant byte first. Byte boundaries are ignored, except that each row of sample data must begin on a byte boundary. If the number of data bits per row is not a multiple of 8, the end of the row is padded with extra bits to fill out the last byte.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Core.PdfString
member.summary: Implements PDF string object. 1.Text String: Used for human-readable characters,such as text annotations,bookmark names,article names and document information.Thes strings are encode- d using either PDFDocEncoding or UTF-16BE with a leading byte-order marker. 2.PDFDoc String: Used for characters and glyphs that are represented in a single byte, using PDFDocEncoding.This type,which reflects a more specific encoding than the text string type. 3.ASCII String: Used for characters that are represented in a single byte using ASCII encoding.Because 7-bit U.S. ASCII is a strict subset of PDFDocEncoding, this value may also be considered to be in that encoding. 4.Byte String: Used for binary data represented as a series of 8-bit bytes,where each byte can be any value representable in 8 bits. The string may represent characters or glyphs but the encoding is not known. The bytes of the st- ring may not represent characters. This type is used for data such as MD5 hash values,signature certificates and Web Capture identification values.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfOrdinarySignatureMaker
member.summary: Pdf ordinary signature maker. A document can contain One or more ordinary signatures.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfMDPSignatureMaker
member.summary: Pdf MDP (modification detection and prevention) signature maker. A document can contain only one MDP signature, it must be the first signed in the document. It enables the author to specify what changes are permitted to be made the document and what changes invalidate the authors signature.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfMDPSignatureMaker.Level1Permissions
member.summary: No changes to the document are permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfMDPSignatureMaker.Level2Permissions
member.summary: Permitted changes are filling in forms, instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate the signature.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfMDPSignatureMaker.Level3Permissions
member.summary: Permitted changes are the same as for 2, as well as annotation creation, deletion, and modification; other changes invalidate the signature

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interactive.DigitalSignatures.PdfSignatureMaker.m_acro6Layers
member.summary: Prior to Acrobat 6.0, signature appearances were manipulated at run-time in order to display the validity of the signature. The validity was shown as a graphic icon and with an additional, optional text message. The manipulated portions of the signature appearance were contained in layers n1, n3 and n4. Beginning with version 6, Acrobat does not maintain support for signature appearances that can be manipulated, though legacy signatures with these appearances may continue to display correctly. Use of layers n1, n3, and n4 is not recommended.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStructureTreeRoot
member.summary: PDFs logical structure facilities provide a mechanism for incorporating structural information about a documents content into a PDF file. Such information might include, for example, the organization of the document into chapters and sections or the identification of special elements such as figures, tables, and footnotes. The logical structure facilities are extensible, allowing applications that produce PDF files to choose what structural information to include and how to represent it, while enabling PDF consumers to navigate a file without knowing the producers structural conventions.

member.summary: For a content stream containing marked-content sequences that are content items, the value is an array of indirect references to the sequences parent structure elements. The array element corresponding to each sequence is found by using the sequences marked-content identifier as a zero-based index into the array.
member.param: The parent structure element of content item.
member.returns: An integer marked-content identifier that uniquely identifies the marked-content sequence within its content stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets Bottom edge of the page

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.ArtifactPropertyList.RightEdge
member.summary: Gets or sets Bottom edge of the page

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Document
member.summary: A complete document. This is the root element of any structure tree containing multiple parts or multiple articles.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Part
member.summary: A large-scale division of a document. This type of element is appropriate for grouping articles or sections.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Article
member.summary: A relatively self-contained body of text constituting a single narrative or exposition. Articles should be disjoint; that is, they should not contain other articles as constituent elements.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Section
member.summary: A container for grouping related content elements. For example, a section might contain a heading, several introductory paragraphs, and two or more other sections nested within it as subsections.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Division
member.summary: A generic block-level element or group of elements.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.BlockQuote
member.summary: A portion of text consisting of one or more paragraphs attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Caption
member.summary: A brief portion of text describing a table or figure.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TOC
member.summary: A list made up of table of contents item entries and/or other nested table of contents entries.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TOCI
member.summary: An individual member of a table of contents.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Index
member.summary: A sequence of entries containing identifying text accompanied by reference elements that point out occurrences of the specified text in the main body of a document.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.NonStruct
member.summary: A grouping element having no inherent structural significance; it serves solely for grouping purposes. This type of element differs from a division (structure type Div) in that it is not interpreted or exported to other document formats; however, its descendants are to be processed normally.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Private
member.summary: A grouping element containing private content belonging to the application producing it. The structural significance of this type of element is unspecified and is determined entirely by the producer application. Neither the Private element nor any of its descendants are to be interpreted or exported to other document formats.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Heading
member.summary: A label for a subdivision of a documents content. It should be the first child of the division that it heads.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.HeadingLevel1
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.HeadingLevel2
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.HeadingLevel3
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.HeadingLevel4
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.HeadingLevel5
member.summary: Headings with specific levels, for use in applications that cannot hierarchically nest their sections and thus cannot determine the level of a heading from its level of nesting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.List
member.summary: A sequence of items of like meaning and importance. Its immediate children should be an optional caption (structure type Caption) followed by one or more list items (structure type LI).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.ListItem
member.summary: An individual member of a list. Its children may be one or more labels, list bodies, or both (structure types Lbl or LBody).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Label
member.summary: A name or number that distinguishes a given item from others in the same list or other group of like items. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the term being defined; in a bulleted or numbered list, it contains the bullet character or the number of the list item and associated punctuation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.ListBody
member.summary: The descriptive content of a list item. In a dictionary list, for example, it contains the definition of the term. It can either contain the content directly or have other BLSEs, perhaps including nested lists, as children.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Table
F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableRow
member.summary: A row of headings or data in a table. It may contain table header cells and table data cells (structure types TH and TD).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableHeaderCell
member.summary: A table cell containing header text describing one or more rows or columns of the table.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableDataCell
member.summary: A table cell containing data that is part of the tables content.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableHeader
member.summary: A group of rows that constitute the header of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the top of each table fragment (although there is only one THead element).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableBody
member.summary: A group of rows that constitute the main body portion of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, the body area may be broken apart on a row boundary. A table may have multiple TBody elements to allow for the drawing of a border or background for a set of rows.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.TableFooter
member.summary: A group of rows that constitute the footer of a table. If the table is split across multiple pages, these rows may be redrawn at the bottom of each table fragment (although there is only one TFoot element.)

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Span
member.summary: generic inline portion of text having no particular inherent characteristics. It can be used, for example, to delimit a range of text with a given set of styling attributes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Quotation
member.summary: An inline portion of text attributed to someone other than the author of the surrounding text.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Note
member.summary: An item of explanatory text, such as a footnote or an endnote, that is referred to from within the body of the document.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Reference
member.summary: A citation to content elsewhere in the document.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.BibEntry
member.summary: A reference identifying the external source of some cited content. It may contain a label (structure type Lbl) as a child.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Code
member.summary: A fragment of computer program text.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Link
member.summary: An association between a portion of the ILSEs content and a corresponding link annotation or annotations. Its children are one or more content items or child ILSEs and one or more object references identifying the associated link annotations.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Annotation
member.summary: An association between a portion of the ILSEs content and a corresponding PDF annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Ruby
member.summary: A side-note (annotation) written in a smaller text size and placed adjacent to the base text to which it refers. It is used in Japanese and Chinese to describe the pronunciation of unusual words or to describe such items as abbreviations and logos. A Rubyelement may also contain the RB, RT, and RP elements

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.RB
member.summary: (Ruby base text) The full-size text to which the ruby annotation is applied. RB can contain text, other inline elements, or a mixture of both. It may have the RubyAlign attribute.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.RT
member.summary: (Ruby annotation text) The smaller-size text that is placed adjacent to the ruby base text. It can contain text, other inline elements, or a mixture of both. It may have the RubyAlignand RubyPosition attributes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.RP
member.summary: (Ruby punctuation) Punctuation surrounding the ruby annotation text. It us used only when a ruby annotation cannot be properly formatted in a ruby style and instead is formatted as a normal comment, or when it is formatted as a warichu. It contains text (usually a single open or close parenthesis or similar bracketing character).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Warichu
member.summary: A comment or annotation in a smaller text size and formatted onto two smaller lines within the height of the containing text line and placed following (inline) the base text to which it refers. It is used in Japanese for descriptive comments and for ruby annotation text that is too long to be aesthetically formatted as a ruby. A Warichu element may also contain the WT and WP elements.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.WT
member.summary: (Warichu text) The smaller-size text of a warichu comment that is formatted into two lines and placed between surrounding WP elements.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.WP
member.summary: (Warichu punctuation) The punctuation that surrounds the WT text. It contains text (usually a single open or close parenthesis or similar bracketing character).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Figure
member.summary: An item of graphical content. Its placement may be specified with the Placementlayout attribute.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStandardStructTypes.Formula
member.summary: A widget annotation representing an interactive form field.

member.summary: A flag indicating whether the document conforms to Tagged PDF conventions.

member.name: M:Spire.Pdf.Interchange.TaggedPdf.PdfStructureElement.AddMarkedContentSequenceContentItem(Spire.Pdf.Primitives.PdfDictionary,Spire.Pdf.Core.PdfStream,Spire.Pdf.Interfaces.IPdfPrimitive,System.Int32)
member.param: The page object representing the page on which the graphics objects in the marked-content sequence are rendered.

The content stream containing the marked-content sequence. This entry should be present only if the marked-content sequence resides in a content stream other than the content stream for the pagefor example, in a form XObject or an annotations appearance stream. If this entry is absent, the marked-content sequence is contained in the content stream of the page identified by Pg (either in the marked-content reference dictionary or in the parent structure element).
The PDF object owning the stream identified by Stmfor example, the annotation to which an appearance stream belongs.
The marked-content identifier of the marked-content sequence within its content stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether to play the sound synchronously or asynchronously. If this flag is true, the viewer application retains control, allowing no further user interaction other than canceling the sound, until the sound has been completely played. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSoundAction.Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to repeat the sound indefinitely. If this entry is present, the property is ignored. Default value: false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSoundAction.Mix
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to mix this sound with any other sound already playing. If this flag is false, any previously playing sound is stopped before starting this sound; this can be used to stop a repeating sound. Default value: false.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction
member.remarks: This type of action allows a user to go to a resource on the Internet, tipically a hypertext link.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.Url
member.value: An string value specifying the full URI for the internet resource.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.HttpMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP method.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.CanonicalDateTimeFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates are converted to the standard format. The interpretation of a form field as a date is not specified explicitly in the field itself but only in the JavaScript code that processes it.
member.value: true if use canonical date time format when submit data; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to submit mouse pointer coordinates. If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action are transmitted as part of the form data.
member.value: true if submit coordinates; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to submit fields without value. If set, all fields designated by the Fields collection and the flag are submitted, regardless of whether they have a value. For fields without a value, only the field name is transmitted.
member.value: true if submit fields without value or the empty ones; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.IncludeIncrementalUpdates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to submit form's incremental updates. Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format. If set, the submitted FDF file includes the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document. If clear, the incremental updates are not included.
member.value: true if incremental updates should be submitted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to submit annotations. Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format. If set, the submitted FDF file includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations are not included.
member.value: true if annotations should be submitted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.ExcludeNonUserAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude non user annotations form submit data stream. Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format and the property is set to true.
member.value: true if non user annotations should be excluded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.EmbedForm
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include form to submit data stream. Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format. If set, the property is a file name containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted.
member.value: true if form should be embedded to submit stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.DataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the submit data format.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitAction.Include
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether fields contained in Fields collection will be included for submitting.
member.remarks: If Include property is true, only the fields in this collection will be submitted. If Include property is false, the fields in this collection are not submitted and only the remaining form fields are submitted. If the collection is null or empty, then all the form fields are reset and the Include property is ignored. If the field has Export property set to false it will be not included for submitting in any case.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags
member.summary: Specifies the available data formats for submitting the form data.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.IncludeExclude
member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/ Exclude flag are submitted, regardless of whether they have a value. For fields without a value, only the field name is transmitted.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.ExportFormat
member.summary: Meaningful only if the SubmitPDF and XFDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values are submitted in HTML Form format. If clear, they are submitted in Forms Data Format

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values are submitted using an HTTP GET request. If clear, they are submitted using a POST request. This flag is meaningful only when the ExportFormat flag is set; if ExportFormat is clear, this flag must also be clear.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submitform action are transmitted as part of the form data.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.Xfdf
member.summary: Meaningful only if the SubmitPDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values are submitted as XML Forms Data Format .

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file includes the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document, as contained in the Differences entry in the FDF dictionary. If clear, the incremental updates are not included.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations are not included.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.SubmitPdf
member.summary: If set, the document is submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf (described in Internet RFC 2045, Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME), Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies; see the Bibliography). If set, all other flags are ignored except GetMethod.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates are converted to the standard format described.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear) and the IncludeAnnotations flag is set. If set, it includes only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user, as determined by the remote server to which the form is being submitted.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.ExclFKey
member.summary: Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF excludes the F entry.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Actions.PdfSubmitFormFlags.EmbedForm
member.summary: Meaningful only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF is a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted.

member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the cutting plane. A three element array specifying the center of rotation on the cutting plane in world space coordinates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the cutting plane color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the intersection color.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the intersection of cutting plane with 3D artwork is visible.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DCrossSection.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the cutting plane opacity. The opacity is given in percents, 100 is full opacity, 0 is no opacity.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DCrossSection.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the cutting plane. A three-element array specifying the orientation of the cutting plane in world space, where each value represents the orientation in relation to the X, Y, and Z axes, respectively. If the array has more than 3 elements, only the first 3 will be considered. Exactly one of the values must be null, indicating an initial state of the cutting plane that is perpendicular to the corresponding axis and clipping all geometry on the positive side of that axis. The other two values must be numbers indicating the rotation of the plane, in degrees, around their corresponding axes. The order in which these rotations are applied should match the order in which the values appear in the array.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationState
member.summary: Specifies an activation state of the 3D annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationState.Instantiated
member.summary: Represents that the state in which the artwork has been read and a run-time instance of the artwork has been created. In this state, it can be rendered but script-driven real-time modifications (that is, animations) are disabled.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationState.Live
member.summary: Represents that the artwork is instantiated, and it is being modified in real time to achieve some animation effect. In the case of keyframe animation, the artwork is live while it is playing and then reverts to an instantiated state when playing completes or is stopped.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationMode
member.summary: Specifies the available modes for activating a 3D annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationMode.PageOpen
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should be activated as soon as the page containing the annotation is opened.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationMode.PageVisible
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should be activated as soon as any part of the page containing the annotation becomes visible.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DActivationMode.ExplicitActivation
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should remain inactive until explicitly activated by a script or user action.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationMode
member.summary: Specifies the available modes for deactivating a 3D annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationMode.PageClose
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should be deactivated as soon as the page is closed.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationMode.PageInvisible
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should be deactivated as soon as the page containing the annotation becomes invisible.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationMode.ExplicitDeactivation
member.summary: Represents that the annotation should remain active until explicitly deactivated by a script or user action.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationState
member.summary: Specifies the available states upon deactivating a 3D annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationState.Uninstantiated
member.summary: Represents the initial state of the artwork before it has been used in any way.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationState.Instantiated
member.summary: Represents that the state in which the artwork has been read and a run-time instance of the artwork has been created. In this state, it can be rendered but script-driven real-time modifications (that is, animations) are disabled.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DDeactivationState.Live
member.summary: Represents that the artwork is instantiated, and it is being modified in real time to achieve some animation effect. In the case of keyframe animation, the artwork is live while it is playing and then reverts to an instantiated state when playing completes or is stopped.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for applying light to 3D artwork.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.Artwork
member.summary: The Lights as specified in the 3D artwork.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.None
member.summary: The lighting specified in the 3D artwork is ignored.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.Night
member.summary: One yellow, one aqua, and one blue infinite light.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.Primary
member.summary: One red, one green, and one blue infinite light.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.Cube
member.summary: Six grey infinite lights aligned with the major axes.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.CAD
member.summary: Three grey infinite lights and one light attached to the camera.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DLightingStyle.Headlamp
member.summary: Single infinite light attached to the camera.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionClipStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available clipping style of the 3D annotation.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies the available Ortho projection scaling mode of the 3D annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode.Width
member.summary: Scale to fit the width of the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode.Height
member.summary: Scale to fit the height of the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode.Min
member.summary: Scale to fit the lesser of width or height of the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode.Max
member.summary: Scale to fit the greater of width or height of the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionOrthoScaleMode.Absolute
member.summary: No scaling should occur due to binding.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DProjectionType
member.summary: Specifies the available projection type of the 3D annotation.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available rendering style of the 3D artwork.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.Solid
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes. In the case of artwork that conforms to the Universal 3D File Format specification, these shapes are triangles.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.SolidWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with single color edges on top of them.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.Transparent
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.TransparentWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency, with single color opaque edges on top of it.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.BoundingBox
member.summary: Displays the bounding box edges of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.TransparentBoundingBox
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.TransparentBoundingBoxOutline
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes edges and faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.Wireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges in a single color.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.ShadedWireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges, though interpolates their color between their two vertices and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.HiddenWireframe
member.summary: Displays edges in a single color, though removes back-facing and obscured edges.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.Vertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices in a single color.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.ShadedVertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices, though uses their vertex color and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.Illustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.SolidOutline
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.Pdf3DRenderStyle.ShadedIllustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces and an additional emissive term to remove poorly lit areas of the artwork.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType
member.summary: Specifies the available animation style for rendering the 3D artwork.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.None
member.summary: Represents that the Keyframe animations should not be driven directly by the viewer application. This value is used by documents that are intended to drive animations through an alternate means, such as JavaScript.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.Linear
member.summary: Represents that the Keyframe animations are driven linearly from beginning to end. This animation style results in a repetitive playthrough of the animation, such as in a walking motion.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.Oscillating
member.summary: Represents that the Keyframe animations should oscillate along their time range. This animation style results in a back-and-forth playing of the animation, such as exploding or collapsing parts.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Collections.PdfFolder.ID
member.summary: (Required;ExtensionLevel3)A non-negative integer value representing the unique folder identification number.Two folders shall not share the same ID value. The folder ID value appears as part of the name tree key of any file associated with this folder.A detailed description of the association between folder and files can be found after this table.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Collections.PdfFolder.Name
member.summary: (Required;ExtensionLevel3)A file name representing the name of the folder.Two sibling folders shall not share the same name following case normalization. Note:Descriptions of file name and case normalization follow this table.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Collections.PdfFolder.Parent
member.summary: (Required for child folders; ExtensionLevel3) An indirect reference to the parent folder of this folder. This entry shall be absent for a root folder.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Collections.PdfFolder.Child
member.summary: (Required if the folder has any descendents; ExtensionLevel3) An indirect reference to the first child folder of this folder.

member.name: P:Spire.Pdf.Collections.PdfFolder.Next
member.summary: (Required for all but the last item at each level; ExtensionLevel3) An indirect reference to the next sibling folder at this level.

FileFormat.SVG:return multiple streams(SVG not support paging,one stream to one page).

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the PDF cross-reference.
member.remarks: Default value is CrossReferenceStream

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceTable
member.summary: The cross-reference table contains information that permits random access to indirect objects within the file so that the entire file need not be read to locate any particular object. The structure is useful for incremental updates, since it allows a new cross-reference section to be added to the PDF file, containing entries only for objects that have been added or deleted. Cross-reference is represented by cross-reference table. The cross-reference table is the traditional way of representing reference type.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceStream
member.summary: Cross-reference is represented by cross-reference stream. Cross-reference streams are stream objects, and contain a dictionary and a data stream. This leads to more compact representation of the file data especially along with the compression enabled. This format is supported by PDF 1.5 version and higher only.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_A1B
member.summary: This PDF/A ISO standard [ISO 19005-1:2005] is based on Adobe PDF version 1.4 and This Level B conformance indicates minimal compliance to ensure that the rendered visual appearance of a conforming file is preservable over the long term.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_X1A2001
member.summary: This PDF/X-1a:2001 ISO standard [ISO 15930-1] is based on Adobe PDF version 1.3 which uses only CMYK + Spot Color and this compliance to ensure that the contents will be reliably reproduced in the repress environment.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_A1A
member.summary: PDF/A-1a ensures the preservation of a document's logical structure and con-tent text stream in natural reading order.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_A2A
member.summary: PDF/A-2a standard,Only check the standard from the pdfaid:part and pdfaid:conformance node,And only check.

member.summary: PDF/A-2b standard,Only check the standard from the pdfaid:part and pdfaid:conformance node,And only check.

member.summary: PDF/A-3a standard,Only check the standard from the pdfaid:part and pdfaid:conformance node,And only check

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field can contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fields text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: If set, text entered in the field is not spell-checked.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: If set, the field does not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than fits within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text is accepted.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Comb
member.summary: Meaningful only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field dictionary and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.RichText
member.summary: If set, the value of this field should be represented as a rich text string. If the field has a value, the RVentry of the field dictionary specifies the rich text string.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
member.summary: If set, exactly one radio button must be selected at all times; clicking the currently selected button has no effect. If clear, clicking the selected button reselects it, leaving no button selected.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a check box. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.PushButton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: If set, a group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison; that is if one is checked, they are all checked. If clear, the buttons are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Edit
member.summary: If set, the combo box includes an editable text box as well as a drop-down list; if clear, it includes only a drop-down list. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo flag is set.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the fields option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: If set, more than one of the fields option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.FieldFlags.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: If set, the new value is committed as soon as a selection is made with the pointing device. This option enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If clear, the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for a field border.
member.remarks: Defaule value is Solid.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle.Solid
member.summary: A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle.Dashed
member.summary: A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle.Beveled
member.summary: A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle.Inset
member.summary: A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfBorderStyle.Underline
member.summary: A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.

member.name: T:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfHighlightMode
member.summary: Specifies the highlight mode for a field.
member.remarks: Defaule value is Invert.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Fields.PdfHighlightMode.Invert
member.summary: Invert the contents of the field rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfMetrics.MacStyle
member.summary: Regular: 0 Bold: 1 Italic: 2 Bold Italic: 3 Bit 0- bold (if set to 1) Bit 1- italic (if set to 1) Bits 2-15- reserved (set to 0). NOTE: Note that macStyle bits must agree with the 'OS/2' table fsSelection bits. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Microsoft Windows. The PANOSE values and 'post' table values are ignored for determining bold or italic fonts.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.MacStyle
member.summary: Regular: 0 Bold: 1 Italic: 2 Bold Italic: 3 Bit 0 - bold (if set to 1) Bit 1 - italic (if set to 1) Bits 2-15 - reserved (set to 0) NOTE: Note that macStyle bits must agree with the 'OS/2' table fsSelection bits. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Microsoft Windows. The PANOSE values and 'post' table values are ignored for determining bold or italic fonts.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.Flags
member.summary: Bit 0 - baseline for font at y=0 Bit 1 - left SideBearing at x=0 Bit 2 - instructions may depend on point size Bit 3 - force ppem to integer values for all private scaler math; may use fractional ppem sizes if this bit is clear Bit 4 - instructions may alter advance width (the advance widths might not scale linearly) Note: All other bits must be zero.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.LowestRecPPEM
member.summary: LowestRecPPEM: Smallest readable size in pixels.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.FontDirectionHint
member.summary: FontDirectionHint: 0 Fully mixed directional glyphs 1 Only strongly left to right 2 Like 1 but also contains neutrals -1 Only strongly right to left -2 Like -1 but also contains neutrals.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.AdvanceWidthMax
member.summary: Maximum advance width value in HTML table.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.NumberOfHMetrics
member.summary: Number of hMetric entries in HTML table; may be smaller than the total number of glyphs in the font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.LineGap
member.summary: Typographic line gap. Negative LineGap values are treated as DEF_TABLE_CHECKSUM in Windows 3.1, System 6, and System 7.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.MinLeftSideBearing
member.summary: Minimum left SideBearing value in HTML table.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.MinRightSideBearing
member.summary: Minimum right SideBearing value; calculated as Min(aw - lsb - (xMax - xMin)).

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.CaretSlopeRise
member.summary: Used to calculate the slope of the cursor (rise/run); 1 for vertical.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.XAvgCharWidth
member.summary: The Average Character Width parameter specifies the arithmetic average of the escapement (width) of all of the 26 lowercase letters a through z of the Latin alphabet and the space character. If any of the 26 lowercase letters are not present, this parameter should equal the weighted average of all glyphs in the font. For non-UGL (platform 3, encoding 0) fonts, use the unweighted average.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWeightClass
member.summary: Indicates the visual weight (degree of blackness or thickness of strokes) of the characters in the font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWidthClass
member.summary: Indicates a relative change from the normal aspect ratio (width to height ratio) as specified by a font designer for the glyphs in a font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.FsType
member.summary: Indicates font embedding licensing rights for the font. Embeddable fonts may be stored in a document. When a document with embedded fonts is opened on a system that does not have the font installed (the remote system), the embedded font may be loaded for temporary (and in some cases, permanent) use on that system by an embedding-aware application. Embedding licensing rights are granted by the vendor of the font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptXSize
member.summary: The recommended horizontal size in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptYSize
member.summary: The recommended vertical size in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptXOffset
member.summary: The recommended horizontal offset in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptYOffset
member.summary: The recommended vertical offset in font design units from the baseline for subscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.ySuperscriptXSize
member.summary: The recommended horizontal size in font design units for superscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSuperscriptYSize
member.summary: The recommended vertical size in font design units for superscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSuperscriptYOffset
member.summary: The recommended vertical offset in font design units from the baseline for superscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YStrikeoutSize
member.summary: Width of the strikeout stroke in font design units.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YStrikeoutPosition
member.summary: The position of the strikeout stroke relative to the baseline in font design units.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.SFamilyClass
member.summary: This parameter is a classification of font-family design.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.Panose
member.summary: This 10 byte series of numbers are used to describe the visual characteristics of a given typeface. These characteristics are then used to associate the font with other fonts of similar appearance having different names. The variables for each digit are listed below. The specifications for each variable can be obtained in the specification PANOSE v2.0 Numerical Evaluation from Microsoft or Elseware Corporation.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.AchVendID
member.summary: The four character identifier for the vendor of the given type face.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.FsSelection
member.summary: Information concerning the nature of the font patterns.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsFirstCharIndex
member.summary: The minimum Unicode index (character code) in this font, according to the cmap subtable for platform ID 3 and encoding ID 0 or 1. For most fonts supporting Win-ANSI or other character sets, this value would be 0x0020.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsLastCharIndex
member.summary: usLastCharIndex: The maximum Unicode index (character code) in this font, according to the cmap subtable for platform ID 3 and encoding ID 0 or 1. This value depends on which character sets the font supports.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoAscender
member.summary: The typographic ascender for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the Ascender value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner. DEF_TABLE_OFFSET good source for usTypoAscender is the Ascender value from an AFM file.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoDescender
member.summary: The typographic descender for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the Descender value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner. DEF_TABLE_OFFSET good source for usTypoDescender is the Descender value from an AFM file.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoLineGap
member.summary: The typographic line gap for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the LineGap value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWinAscent
member.summary: The ascender metric for Windows. This too is distinct from Apple's Ascender value and from the usTypoAscender values. usWinAscent is computed as the yMax for all characters in the Windows ANSI character set. usTypoAscent is used to compute the Windows font height and default line spacing. For platform 3 encoding 0 fonts, it is the same as yMax.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWinDescent
member.summary: The descender metric for Windows. This too is distinct from Apple's Descender value and from the usTypoDescender values. usWinDescent is computed as the -yMin for all characters in the Windows ANSI character set. usTypoAscent is used to compute the Windows font height and default line spacing. For platform 3 encoding 0 fonts, it is the same as -yMin.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UlCodePageRange1
member.summary: This field is used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for platform 3, encoding ID 1 (Microsoft platform). If the font file is encoding ID 0, then the Symbol Character Set bit should be set. If the bit is set (1) then the code page is considered functional. If the bit is clear (0) then the code page is not considered functional. Each of the bits is treated as an independent flag and the bits can be set in any combination. The determination of "functional" is left up to the font designer, although character set selection should attempt to be functional by code pages if at all possible.

member.name: F:Spire.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UlCodePageRange2
member.summary: This field is used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for platform 3, encoding ID 1 (Microsoft platform). If the font file is encoding ID 0, then the Symbol Character Set bit should be set. If the bit is set (1) then the code page is considered functional. If the bit is clear (0) then the code page is not considered functional. Each of the bits is treated as an independent flag and the bits can be set in any combination. The determination of "functional" is left up to the font designer, although character set selection should attempt to be functional by code pages if at all possible.
